titleInfo.title: USA v. Alexander
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 13 Motion to Continue Trial as to William B. Alexander (1). Jury Trial continued to 8/18/2008 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1 - Lincoln before Judge Richard G. Kopf. The time between July 1, 2008 and August 18, 2008 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 13 Motion to Continue Trial as to William B. Alexander (1). Jury Trial continued to 8/18/2008 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1 - Lincoln before Judge Richard G. Kopf. The time between July 1, 2008 and August 18, 2008 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (JAB)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alexander
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant William B. Alexander. I have been advised that the parties have agreed to a nonjury trial in this case. Because an extended civil case has been set for trial on August 18, 2008, it will be necessary to reschedule this criminal case for trial. Accordingly, the parties shall arrange a telephone conference with the undersigned.IT IS SO ORDERED. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant William B. Alexander. I have been advised that the parties have agreed to a nonjury trial in this case. Because an extended civil case has been set for trial on August 18, 2008, it will be necessary to reschedule this criminal case for trial. Accordingly, the parties shall arrange a telephone conference with the undersigned.IT IS SO ORDERED. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alexander
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report and Addendum as to defendant William B. Alexander. It is ordered that:... (2) The defendant's objection to the enhancement at paragraph 23 of the presentence report set forth in the addendum will be resolved at sentencing. (3)Except to the extent (if at all) that I have sustained an objection or granted a motion or reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects. ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alexander
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant William B. Alexander. On the oral motion of the defendant, and without objection by the government, IT IS ORDERED that Defendant Alexander's sentencing is continued to Tuesday, January 13, 2009, at 12:00 noon, before the undersigned United States district judge, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present unless excused by the court. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant William B. Alexander. On the oral motion of the defendant, and without objection by the government, IT IS ORDERED that Defendant Alexander's sentencing is continued to Tuesday, January 13, 2009, at 12:00 noon, before the undersigned United States district judge, in Courtroom No. 1, United States Courthouse and Federal Building, 100 Centennial Mall North, Lincoln, Nebraska. The defendant shall be present unless excused by the court. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Alexander
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to William B. Alexander. Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is hereby sentenced to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a term of fifteen (15) months; two (2) years of Supervised Release with Special Conditions; $100 Special Assessment. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons no earlier than 90 days as to defendant William B. Alexander. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(GJG)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska

The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons no earlier than 90 days as to defendant William B. Alexander. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (4 Certified copies to USM)(GJG)
